revised_title: Study of Vapour Molecule Interaction with Crystal Surfaces
tldr: The author investigates the interaction of vapour molecules with crystal surfaces, focusing on the coefficient of condensation. They use crystals that sublime at ordinary temperatures, such as iodine, to study the effect of molecular dipole moments on the condensation process. The experiments reveal that polar crystals have smaller condensation coefficients, indicating that molecular orientation in the solid state may influence these values.
